epics.title: Task Management Core Functionality
epics.description: Develop the core features of the To-Do List application, enabling users to add, edit, mark as completed, and delete tasks. This epic is critical as it delivers the primary business value: allowing users to manage their daily tasks efficiently.

stories.title: Add a New Task
stories.description: As a user, I want to add a new task with a title and optional description so that I can keep track of things I need to do.
acceptance_criteria: User can enter a task title (required) and description (optional).
Task is added to the top of the task list upon submission.
Input fields are cleared after adding a task.
Validation error shown if title is empty.

subtasks.title: Design Add Task UI
subtasks.description: Create UI components for adding a new task, including input fields and submit button.

subtasks.title: Implement Add Task Logic (Frontend)
subtasks.description: Implement logic to capture user input and trigger task creation.

subtasks.title: Implement Add Task API (Backend)
subtasks.description: Create backend endpoint to accept new task data and store it in the database.

subtasks.title: Test Add Task Functionality
subtasks.description: Write and execute test cases to ensure tasks can be added and validation works.

stories.title: Edit an Existing Task
stories.description: As a user, I want to edit the title or description of an existing task so I can update my tasks as needed.
acceptance_criteria: User can open an edit form for any task.
User can update the title and/or description.
Changes are saved and reflected in the task list.
Validation error shown if title is empty.

subtasks.title: Design Edit Task UI
subtasks.description: Create UI for editing a task, including modal or inline editing.

subtasks.title: Implement Edit Task Logic (Frontend)
subtasks.description: Implement logic to update task details and handle form submission.

subtasks.title: Implement Edit Task API (Backend)
subtasks.description: Create backend endpoint to update task details in the database.

subtasks.title: Test Edit Task Functionality
subtasks.description: Write and execute test cases for editing tasks and validation.

stories.title: Mark Task as Completed
stories.description: As a user, I want to mark a task as completed so I can track my progress.
acceptance_criteria: User can mark any task as completed.
Completed tasks are visually distinguished (e.g., strikethrough, color change).
Completed status is persisted after reload.

subtasks.title: Design Completed Task UI
subtasks.description: Update UI to visually distinguish completed tasks.

subtasks.title: Implement Mark as Completed Logic (Frontend)
subtasks.description: Implement logic to toggle completed status for tasks.

subtasks.title: Implement Update Task Status API (Backend)
subtasks.description: Create backend endpoint to update the completed status of a task.

subtasks.title: Test Mark as Completed Functionality
subtasks.description: Write and execute test cases for marking tasks as completed.

stories.title: Delete a Task
stories.description: As a user, I want to delete a task so I can remove tasks I no longer need.
acceptance_criteria: User can delete any task.
Deleted tasks are removed from the list immediately.
User is prompted for confirmation before deletion.

subtasks.title: Design Delete Task UI
subtasks.description: Add delete button and confirmation dialog to task items.

subtasks.title: Implement Delete Task Logic (Frontend)
subtasks.description: Implement logic to trigger task deletion and update UI.

subtasks.title: Implement Delete Task API (Backend)
subtasks.description: Create backend endpoint to delete a task from the database.

subtasks.title: Test Delete Task Functionality
subtasks.description: Write and execute test cases for deleting tasks and confirmation dialog.

epics.title: Task List Display & User Experience
epics.description: Design and implement the user interface for displaying all tasks in a list, ensuring usability and responsiveness across devices. This epic is essential for providing a seamless and intuitive user experience.

stories.title: Display All Tasks in a List
stories.description: As a user, I want to see all my tasks in a list so I can easily view and manage them.
acceptance_criteria: All tasks are displayed in a scrollable list.
Each task shows its title, description, and completed status.
List updates in real-time as tasks are added, edited, completed, or deleted.

subtasks.title: Design Task List UI
subtasks.description: Create UI components for displaying tasks in a list format.

subtasks.title: Implement Task List Rendering Logic
subtasks.description: Implement logic to fetch and render tasks from the backend.

subtasks.title: Implement Get Tasks API (Backend)
subtasks.description: Create backend endpoint to retrieve all tasks from the database.

subtasks.title: Test Task List Display
subtasks.description: Write and execute test cases for displaying tasks and real-time updates.

stories.title: Responsive Design for Desktop and Mobile
stories.description: As a user, I want the app to work well on both desktop and mobile browsers so I can manage tasks from any device.
acceptance_criteria: UI adapts to various screen sizes and orientations.
All features are accessible and usable on mobile devices.
No horizontal scrolling required on mobile.

subtasks.title: Design Responsive Layout
subtasks.description: Create wireframes and design assets for responsive layouts.

subtasks.title: Implement Responsive Styles
subtasks.description: Apply CSS and frontend logic to ensure responsiveness.

subtasks.title: Test Responsiveness
subtasks.description: Test app on various devices and browsers for responsiveness.

stories.title: User Experience Enhancements
stories.description: As a user, I want the app to be intuitive and visually appealing so I can use it easily.
acceptance_criteria: Consistent color scheme and typography.
Clear feedback for user actions (e.g., adding, editing, deleting).
Accessible for users with disabilities.

subtasks.title: Design UX/UI Enhancements
subtasks.description: Design visual and interaction improvements for the app.

subtasks.title: Implement UX/UI Enhancements
subtasks.description: Apply design improvements and accessibility features.

subtasks.title: Test UX/UI Enhancements
subtasks.description: Test for usability and accessibility compliance.

stories.title: Performance Optimization
stories.description: As a user, I want the app to load quickly (within 3 seconds) so I can access my tasks without delay.
acceptance_criteria: App loads within 3 seconds on standard broadband/mobile connections.
No blocking scripts or large assets.
Performance tested on desktop and mobile.

subtasks.title: Optimize Frontend Assets
subtasks.description: Minimize and bundle frontend assets for fast loading.

subtasks.title: Optimize Backend Performance
subtasks.description: Optimize backend queries and endpoints for fast response.

subtasks.title: Performance Testing
subtasks.description: Test app load times and optimize as needed.

epics.title: Infrastructure, Deployment & Quality Assurance
epics.description: Set up the technical infrastructure, deployment pipelines, and quality assurance processes to ensure the To-Do List app is robust, maintainable, and easily deployable.

stories.title: Set Up Hosting and Deployment Pipeline
stories.description: As a developer, I want automated deployment pipelines so that the app can be reliably deployed to production.
acceptance_criteria: Source code repository is set up.
CI/CD pipeline is configured for automated builds and deployments.
App is hosted and accessible via a public URL.

subtasks.title: Set Up Source Code Repository
subtasks.description: Create and configure a repository (e.g., GitHub, GitLab) for code management.

subtasks.title: Configure CI/CD Pipeline
subtasks.description: Set up automated build and deployment pipeline (e.g., GitHub Actions, Jenkins).

subtasks.title: Provision Hosting Environment
subtasks.description: Set up cloud hosting (e.g., AWS, Azure, Vercel) for the app.

stories.title: End-to-End Testing
stories.description: As a QA engineer, I want to ensure the app works as expected through comprehensive end-to-end tests.
acceptance_criteria: Automated end-to-end tests cover all user flows.
Manual exploratory testing is performed.
All critical bugs are resolved before launch.

subtasks.title: Write Automated E2E Tests
subtasks.description: Develop automated tests for all major user flows.

subtasks.title: Manual Exploratory Testing
subtasks.description: Perform manual testing to find edge cases and usability issues.

subtasks.title: Bug Triage and Resolution
subtasks.description: Log, prioritize, and verify fixes for critical bugs.

stories.title: Product Management & Documentation
stories.description: As a product manager, I want clear documentation and project tracking so the team can deliver efficiently.
acceptance_criteria: Project plan and timeline are documented.
User stories and acceptance criteria are tracked.
Release notes and user documentation are available.

subtasks.title: Create Project Plan & Timeline
subtasks.description: Document project milestones, deliverables, and deadlines.

subtasks.title: Track Stories & Acceptance Criteria
subtasks.description: Maintain up-to-date tracking of user stories and criteria.

subtasks.title: Prepare Release Notes & User Docs
subtasks.description: Write release notes and basic user documentation.

stories.title: Security & Privacy Compliance
stories.description: As an IT specialist, I want to ensure the app follows basic security and privacy best practices, even without user accounts.
acceptance_criteria: No sensitive data is stored.
App is protected against common web vulnerabilities (e.g., XSS, CSRF).
Privacy policy is available.

subtasks.title: Implement Security Best Practices
subtasks.description: Apply security headers, input validation, and other protections.

subtasks.title: Draft Privacy Policy
subtasks.description: Prepare a simple privacy policy for users.

subtasks.title: Security Testing
subtasks.description: Test for vulnerabilities and verify compliance.
